column4: anyone know what to do to get ubuntu 10.10 to install on a dell inspiron m5010 -- there is an obvious problem (something to do with "acpi = off"?) ...
can you hear the install disc spinning
check the BIOS, see if there are any SATA compatibility modes you can toggle
I've had a problem before where the CD drive wouldn't spin because of a BIOS option yes
if it turns out that's what it is, and if you'r dual booting Windows, remember to toggle it back before booting Windows
- how can I get kernel boot parameters when it doesn't even let me in
you'd need the GRUB menu screen
not even when holding SHIFT during bootup?
you're just trying to install Ubuntu, right?  For a dual boot or just Ubuntu alone?
got it going pci=noacpi -- whats that?  (pls)
there's a pref for just seeing or actually being able to do stuff, too, IIRC
well you _could_ probably do it from SSH but =P
I think it's because of compiz on the server machine (vinagre can't control)
